column4: it really concerns me that my notebook fan never seems to come on when in ubuntu.  only when i reboot to windows.  weird
if the notebook doesnt get hot, there should be no problem
the thing is, when i reboot, the fan comes on, and the air behing pushed out is really hot
just feel if the notebook is really hot, if so, that could be bad
and it stays on for a long time.  am looking for lmsensors info now
well if the notebook itself doesnt get hot it should be no problem or do i misunderstand anything?
also, when it gets too hot, it should shutdown automatically
I'm just concerned that as soon as i reboot, the fan will come on for an extended period of time
also, i sat at grub screen for 5 minutes, waiting for the air comin from the notebook to cool down
i just noticed the fan beeing more quiet since i used dapper and my hard-disk doesnt get so hot anymore too (and the battery lasts longer)
dapper works without a flaw here
better download the cd or even better... wait
you would have to download around 600-whatever mb anyway so you can also just download the iso image (so you can re-use it)
